title: The Bachelor's Sogand Mohtat flaunts her endless pins at the Fudge Clean Blonde launch in Sydney
text:
She was sent packing by Matt Agnew on the last season of The Bachelor.

But on Thursday, Sogand Mohtat showed the former suitor exactly what he missed out on as she attended the Fudge Clean Blonde launch in Sydney.

The 30-year-old flaunted her endless pins in a black figure-hugging one shoulder mini dress.

Thigh's the limit! The Bachelor's Sogand Mohtat (pictured) flaunted her endless pins in a mini dress at the Fudge Clean Blonde launch on Thursday

She accessorised her stylish ensemble with a pair of studded stilettos and a black clutch.

The former Bachelor star styled her brunette locks in waves which fell effortlessly by her shoulders.

She opted for a full face of make-up consisting of a smoky eye, rosy cheeks and a pink lip.

Stylish: Sogand accessorised her stylish ensemble with a pair of studded stilettos and a black clutch

All smiles: The former Bachelor star styled her brunette locks in waves which fell effortlessly by her shoulders

Sogand rose to fame after appearing on the last season of The Bachelor with astrophysicist Matt Agnew.

While she scored the season's first date and first kiss with Matt, 32, her time on The Bachelor was short.

Sogand found herself at the centre of a feud with her co-star Abbie Chatfield - and the pair ended up clashing a number of times.

Strike a pose: Sogand (pictured) opted for a full face of make-up consisting of a smoky eye, rosy cheeks and a pink lip

Debut: Sogand rose to fame after appearing on the last season of The Bachelor with astrophysicist Matt Agnew

Sogand was left heartbroken after her elimination and slammed Abbie's behaviour.

Speaking to Sunday Confidential at the time, she said: '[Abbie] is a manipulator. And it is time I tell her how it is.'

'I couldn't hold back after seeing how Abbie was one way in front of us girls when the cameras were rolling, then another way to Matt,' she told the publication.
description: She was sent packing by Matt Agnew on the last season of The Bachelor.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
